page.title: 11RECREATION
page.content: In Tredegar we have the Leisure Centre. The sports it organises are football, swimming, tennis, roller-skating and netball. The parks in the area are not safe for children. There is a lot of rubbish which has been left, plastic bags and broken glass bottles. In Tredegar Park, there are bowling greens, tennis courts, swings, slides and a round-about. There is a new county park in Tredegar, in this park there are water sports, fishing, camping, walking and there will be an aeroplane landing site. Swimming is the activity which everybody enjoys. In the park there is an open air pool - it's no wonder it only costs 20p because it is always cold. In Tredegar we have many kinds of sporting activities for both old and young.
